snippet: Thousands of protesters poured into the streets of Cairo and other cities for a second night on Sunday to vent their anger at the verdicts.
abstract: Thousands of protesters pour into the streets of Cairo and other Egyptian cities to vent their anger at the weak verdicts against former president Hosni Mubarak and his key associates; Judge Ahmed Rafaat pronounced Mubarak guilty as an accessory to the murder of protesters, declaring that the case included no evidence that Mubarak ordered the killings.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh and Liam Stack contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Thousands of protesters poured into the streets of Cairo and other cities for a second night on Sunday to vent their anger at the verdicts.

headline.seo: Political Clashes and Vow of Appeal in Mubarak Verdict
headline.main: Political Clashes and Vow of Appeal in Verdict on Mubarak and Aides
headline.print_headline: Political Clashes and Vow of Appeal in Verdict on Mubarak and Aides
